By Ujjwal Narayan and Siddhi Nayak
NewsRise
Recasts lead; adds details
NEW DELHI (Jan 5) -- The Delhi High Court today put on hold Future Group’s arbitration proceedings with Amazon in Singapore court, and stayed yesterday’s order dismissing the Indian company’s plea.

Further, the division bench of Delhi High Court issued notice to Amazon, deferring the next hearing to Feb. 1

In 2019, Amazon invested $200 million in Future Coupons for a 49% stake, which gave the U.S. company a 7.3% foothold in flagship Future Retail.

However, the two companies fell out after debt-laden Future Group agreed to sell its retail, wholesale, warehousing, and logistics businesses in August 2020 to billionaire Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries in a $3.4 billion deal. The deal with Reliance is crucial to Future Group, which is on the brink of liquidation.

Meanwhile, Amazon tried to block the deal by getting a freeze order from Singapore arbitration court. Future Group’s prospective sell out to Reliance threatens the U.S. company’s dominance in India.

A single-judge bench of Justice Amit Bansal had, yesterday, dismissed Future Group’s petition, refusing to interfere in the arbitration proceedings at the Singapore court. Future Group today urged the Delhi High Court to urgently hear an appeal against that order.

Future Group sought the court to terminate the proceedings in Singapore tribunal after the Competition Commission of India (CCI), last month, kept its approval for the 2019 deal on hold, accusing the U.S. e-commerce company of hiding information while seeking regulatory approval. The suspension of CCI approval clears way for Future’s merger with Reliance.

Future Group urged the Singapore court to terminate proceedings after the CCI order suspended the 2019 deal. The tribunal agreed to hear Future Group’s plea only after the main hearing in the arbitration case between Jan. 5 and 7, following which the Indian company approached the Delhi High Court.
